- flera l√§kemedel (del av samma l√§kemedelsregim) som ordinerats samtidigt. Exempelvis trippelbehandling f√∂r mags√•r; och

Arketypen har d√§rf√∂r utformats f√∂r att hantera olika komplexiteter:
- enkla best√§llningsinstruktioner som "furosemid 40 mg tv√• tabletter p√• morgonen och en vid lunch" f√∂r att s√§kerst√§lla kompatibilitet med befintliga system; och

Arketypen har √§ven utformats s√• att strukturen f√∂r alla l√§kemedelsbest√§llningar omfattar:

Arketypen √§r √§ven l√§mplig f√∂r best√§llning av parenterala v√§tskor, trots att dessa normalt √§r "ordinationsbara" artiklar. I andra fall kan dock en separat "parenteral v√§tskebest√§llning" vara l√§mpligt. 

De SLOTs som inneh√•ller CLUSTER-arketyper anv√§nds f√∂r att representera vis del av inneh√•llet. Detta grundas p√• tre sk√§l:

F√∂r l√§kemedel f√∂resl√•s en kandidatarketyp. Det √§r √§ven m√∂jligt att andra CLUSTER-arketyper i framtiden kan kr√§vas f√∂r ytterlige √§ndam√•l, s√•som komplexa parenterala nutritionsordrar;
- f√∂r att st√∂dja √•teranv√§ndning av arketyper i situationer d√§r inneh√•llet anv√§nds i flera kliniska sammanhang, i synnerhet ACTION.medication-arketypen som anv√§nds f√∂r registrering av dispensering, administrering osv; och

es-ar.purpose: Registrar todos los aspectos de una orden de medicamento, vacuna, producto nutricional u otro √≠tem terap√©utico para un individuo identificado.
es-ar.use:
Utilizar para el registro de todos los aspectos de una orden de medicamento, vacuna, producto nutricional u otro √≠tem terap√©utico para un individuo identificado.

Su objetivo es la utilizaci√≥n para cualquier orden de medicamento o √≠tems relacionados, ya sea que los prescriba un profesional de la salud o que se encuentren disponibles sin receta m√©dica. El alcance de este arquetipo de medicamento incluye √≥rdenes de vacuna, fluidos parenterales u otros insumos terp√©uticos tales como vendajes, productos nutricionales u otros √≠tems que se aplican o son administrados para obtener un efecto terap√©utico, y que tiene un patr√≥n com√∫n de registro de datos.

Este arquetipo seta dise√±ado para ser utilizado en un conjunto de contexto cl√≠nicos que incluyen, pero no se limitan, a:
- un registro de una consulta cl√≠nica (COMPOSITION.encounter);
- una prescripci√≥n escrita por un m√©dico, odont√≥logo, enfermero u otro profesional de la salud, para una medicaci√≥n o producto nutricional a ser dispensado y administrado (como parte de una COMPOSITION.prescription);
- un √≠tem incluido en una lista de medicamentos recibidos actualmente, en una prescripci√≥n o en una lista de medicamentos (como parte de una COMPOSITION.medication_list); y como
- un √≠tem incluido en un documento de resumen, tal como una transferencia de sitio de cuidados (COMPOSITION.transfer_summary) o una interconsulta (COMPOSITION.request).

En muchos casos una orden de medicamento ser√° simple -t√≠picamente para un solo √≠tem medicamentoso con instrucciones carentes de complejidad para su dispensaci√≥n y administraci√≥n. Sin embargo, este arquetipo tambi√©n esta dise√±ado para permitir √≥rdenes terap√©uticas mas complejas, como por ejemplo:
- la reducci√≥n de una dosis de prednisolona a lo largo de un per√≠odo de semanas;
- la titulaci√≥n de insulina, donde la dosis depender√° de los resultados de una prueba;
- la prescripci√≥n simultanea de varios medicamentos como parte de un r√©gimen √∫nico de medicamentos, tales como la terapia triple para la √∫lcera p√©ptica; y
- la administraci√≥n endovenosa de medicamentos o suplementos nutricionales, incluyendo nutrici√≥n parenteral.

El arquetipo ha sido por lo tanto dise√±ado para permitir diversos rangos de complejidad, desde:
- instrucciones narrativas simples para √≥rdenes tales como "furosemida 40 miligramos, dos tabletas por la ma√±ana y una al almuerzo", para asegurar la compatibilidad con sistemas existentes
- la cantidad de la medicaci√≥n, usualmente representada en t√©rminos de un n√∫mero y su correspondiente unidad de dosis, pero que alternativamente puede ser representada mediante una narrativa para asegurar compatibilidad con sistemas existentes y la cobertura de diferentes escenarios cl√≠nicos; hasta
- el detalle estructurado de la dosis, v√≠a de administraci√≥n y temporalidad, para as√≠ representar una especificaci√≥n completamente computable.

Tambi√©n ha sido dise√±ado de modo tal que la estructura de una sola orden de medicamento permita representar:
- una secuencia compleja de √≥rdenes de medicamento que utiliza la misma potencia del preparado como una sola estructura de orden; y
- m√∫ltiples √≥rdenes de medicamentos encadenadas en circunstancias donde diferentes medicamentos o preparados deben ser administrados conforme a una secuencia.

Este arquetipo es tambi√©n adecuado para ordenar fluidos en entornos de cuidado donde es de uso corriente que estos √≠tems sean "prescribibles". EN otros contextos una orden separada de fluido parenteral podr√≠a ser mas apropiada.

Los SLOTs que contienen arquetipos CLUSTER han sido utilizados para representar parte del contenido por tres razones:
- Para asegurar un arquetipo de base que pueda ser utilizado en todos los casos arriba descritos pero que permitan flexibilidad alli donde esta es requerida, como por ejemplo el SLOT `Detalles de la preparaci√≥n¬¥ en el cual un mayor detalle estructurado puede ser agregado. Se ha sugerido un arquetipo candidato para Medicaciones. Es posible que otros arquetipos CLUSTER sean necesarios en el futuro para otros prop√≥sitos tal como las √≥rdenes de nutrici√≥n parenteral compleja;
- Para permitir la re-utilizaci√≥n del arquetipo en situaciones en las cuales el contenido ha sido identificado como utilizado tambi√©n en otros contextos cl√≠nicos, en particular en forma apareada como el arquetipo ACTION.medication, para el registro de la dispensaci√≥n, administraci√≥n, etc. concretas; y
- Para remover del arquetipo base los contenidos menos com√∫nmente utilizados.

Varias √≥rdenes pueden ser representadas como actividades separadas dentro de una sola instancia de este arquetipo, para el uso de √≥rdenes fuertemente vinculadas (como la terapia del Helicobacter Pylori) cuando estas nos son prescriptas como paquete √∫nico.

Debe tenerse en cuenta que estos usos subsumen lso casos de uso tanto de la Orden de Medicamento FHIR como de la Declaraci√≥n de Medicamento, es decir que este arquetipo coincide con ambos recursos FHIR, utilizados en el contexto apropiado.
es-ar.misuse:
No debe ser utilizado para el registro de las actividades relacionadas con el cumplimiento de la orden del medicamento, vacuna, producto nutricional o √≠tem terap√©utico, tal como los detalles de su administraci√≥n o dispensa. Se debe utilizar el ACTION.medication para este prop√≥sito.

No debe ser utilizado para el registro de √≥rdenes de sangre o sus preparados, lo cual involucra un proceso cl√≠nico fundamentalmente diferente que muy probablemente requiera otro tipo de informaci√≥n. Se debe utilizar el ACTION.transfusion para este prop√≥sito.

No debe ser utilizado para el registro de √≥rdenes de inserci√≥n de implantes o dispositivos m√©dicos tales como marcapasos o defibriladores. Se debe utilizar el ACTION.procedure para este prop√≥sito.

nb.purpose: For √• registrere alle aspekter av ordinering av et legemiddel, en vaksine, ern√¶ringsprodukt eller medisinsk forbruksmateriell for et spesifikt individ.
nb.use:
Brukes for √• registrere alle aspekter av ordinering av et legemiddel, en vaksine, en√¶ringsvare eller medisinsk forbruksmateriell for et spesifikt individ.

Arketypen kan brukes i alle legemiddelrelaterte ordineringer, enten de er for reseptpliktige legemidler ordinert av en kliniker, eller for reseptfrie legemidler. Arketypen dekker ogs√• ordinering av vaksiner, parenterale v√¶sker, eller medisinsk forbruksmateriell, som bandasjer, ern√¶ringsprodukter eller andre varer som p√•f√∏res eller administreres for √• ha en terapeutisk effekt, og der dataene som skal registreres er de samme.

Arketypen er designet for bruk i en rekke ulike kliniske sammenhenger, for eksempel:
- en registrering i en klinisk konsultasjon (COMPOSITION.encounter).
- en resept skrevet av en lege, tannlege eller annet helsepersonell, p√• et legemiddel eller ern√¶ringsprosdukt som skal utdeles eller administreres (i en COMPOSITION.prescription).
- et element i en legemiddelliste, resept eller legemiddelkurve (COMPOSITION.medication_list)
- et element i et oppsummeringsdokument som f.eks. en epikrise (COMPOSITION.transfer_summary) eller en henvisning (COMPOSITION.request).

Merk at disse bruksomr√•dene omfatter FHIR-ressursene for b√•de Medication Order og Medication Statement.

I mange tilfeller vil legemiddelordineringen v√¶re enkel - typisk for en enkelt legemiddelvare med ukompliserte instruksjoner for utdeling og administrering. Arketypen er imidlertid ogs√• utviklet for √• tillate mer komplekse ordineringer, for eksempel:
- ved nedtrapping av en prednisolondose over flere uker.
- ved titrering av insulin, hvor dosering er avhengig av pr√∏veresultater.
- flere legemidler ordinert p√• samme tidspunkt som en del av et samlet behandlingsregime, for eksempel trippelbehandling for mages√•r.
- ved parenteral administrering av legemidler eller ern√¶ring, inkludert parenteral ern√¶ring.

Arketypen er derfor utviklet for √• tillate ulik kompleksitet, fra
- enkle fritekstinstrukser for ordineringer som "Furosemid 40 mg, to tabletter om morgenen og en til lunsj" for √• sikre kompatibilitet med eksisterende systemer, og
- legemiddelmengden representeres som regel ved et tall med tilh√∏rende m√•leenhet, alternativt med fritekst for √• sikre kompatibilitet med eksisterende systemer og for √• dekke alle kliniske scenarier
til
- strukturerte detaljer for dose, administreringssvei og administreringsstidspunkter for at datamaskiner skal kunne lese og gj√∏re beregninger med dataene.

Arketypen er designet slik at en enkel legemiddelordinering kan representere:
-komplekse sekvensielle legemiddelordineringer som bruker samme preparatstyrke i samme ordineringsstruktur.
-flere legemiddelordineringer kan lenkes, der ulike legemidler eller blandinger m√• administreres sekvensielt.

Arketypen er ogs√• egnet for √• ordinere v√¶sker, der det er vanlig at disse ordineres. I andre sammenhenger kan det v√¶re mer passende √• bruke en egen arketype for v√¶skeforordninger.

Mengden av et legemiddel representeres vanligvis med et tall og en enhet, men det kan ogs√• dokumenteres i fritekst for √• sikre kompatibilitet med eksisterende systemer og for √• dekke alle scenarier.

SLOTer med CLUSTER-arketyper brukes for √• representere deler av innholdet av tre √•rsaker:
- For √• sikre en kjernearketype som kan brukes i alle de overnevnte brukscasene, men likevel v√¶re fleksibel der det trengs, f.eks. i SLOTet "Legemiddeldetaljer" der ytterligere strukturerte detaljer kan legges til. Det er foresl√•tt en arketype for detaljer om legemidler, og det kan tenkes at man i fremtiden vil trenge andre CLUSTER-arketyper for andre form√•l, som f.eks. komplekse ordineringer av parenteral ern√¶ring.
- for √• tillate gjenbruk av arketyper i situasjoner hvor innholdet ogs√• brukes i andre kliniske kontekster, i hovedsak i den tilh√∏rende arketypen ACTION.medication for √• registrere faktisk utdeling, administrering osv.
- for √• fjerne mindre brukt innhold fra arketypens rammeverk.

Det er mulig √• legge inn flere ordinasjoner som aktiviteter innenfor √©n instans av arketypen for √• representere tett sammenbundne ordinasjoner av forskjellige legemidler, for eksempel en legemiddelpakke mot H. pylori der denne ikke ordineres som en enkelt pakning.

Merk at disse bruksomr√•dene innbefatter FHIR-ressursene for b√•de "Medication Order" og "Medication Statement", det vil si at denne arketypen matcher begge disse FHIR-ressursene i passende brukssammenhenger.
nb.misuse:
Skal ikke brukes for √• registrere faktisk administrering eller utdeling av legemidler, vaksiner, parenterale v√¶sker, ern√¶ringsprodukter eller medisinsk forbruksmateriell. Bruk arketypen ACTION.medication for dette form√•let.

Skal ikke brukes for √• registrere ordinering av blodkomponenter, som omfatter en fundamentalt ulik klinisk prosess og sannsynligvis vil trenge ulik st√∏tteinformasjon. Bruk arketypen INSTRUCTION.transfusion for dette form√•let.

Skal ikke brukes for √• registrere ordinering av innlegging av implantater og medisinsk utstyr som pacemakere og defibrillatorer. Bruk arketypen INSTRUCTION.procedure for dette form√•let.

pt-br.use:
Utilizado para registrar todos os aspectos da prescri√ß√£o de medicamentos, vacinas, produtos nutricionais ou outros itens terap√™uticos, para um indiv√≠duo identificado.

Destina-se a ser usado para qualquer tipo de medicamento e prescri√ß√£o relacionada, quer seja prescrito por um profissional de sa√∫de ou dispon√≠vel para compra "no balc√£o"da farm√°cia. O escopo deste arqu√©tipo de medicamentos tamb√©m inclui prescri√ß√µes de vacinas, fluidos parenterais ou outros produtos terap√™uticos, como bandagens, produtos nutricionais ou outros √≠tens que possuem um padr√£o comum para o seu registro e s√£o aplicados ou administrados com vistas a um efeito terap√™utico. 

Este arqu√©tipo √© projetado para ser usado em v√°rios contextos cl√≠nicos, incluindo, entre outros:
- um registro em uma consulta cl√≠nica (COMPOSITION.encounter);
- uma receita escrita por um m√©dico, dentista, ou outro profissional de sa√∫de autorizado para prescrever uma medicamento ou produto nutricional a ser dispensado e administrado (COMPOSITION.prescription);
- um √≠tem em uma lista atual de medicamento, receita ou carta de medicamentos (dentro de COMPOSITION.medication_list); e
- um √≠tem em um documento de resumo, como a transfer√™ncia de cuidados (COMPOSITION.transfer_summary) ou um documento de contra-refer√™ncia (COMPOSITION.request).

Em muitos casos, uma prescri√ß√£o de medicamento ser√° simples - tipicamente para um √∫nico item de medicamento com instru√ß√µes simples para a sua dispensa√ß√£o e administra√ß√£o. No entanto, este arqu√©tipo foi tamb√©m projetado para permitir prescri√ß√µes mais complexas. Por exemplo:

-	uma redu√ß√£o de dose de prednisolona durante um per√≠odo de semanas;
-	fracionamento de insulina, com dosagem dependente dos resultados do teste;
-	medicamentos m√∫ltiplos prescritos simultaneamente como parte de um regime de f√°rmaco √∫nico, como uma terapia tripla para √∫lcera p√©ptica; e
-	administra√ß√£o intravenosa de medicamentos ou suplementos nutricionais, incluindo nutri√ß√£o parenteral.

O arqu√©tipo foi, portanto, projetado para atender prescri√ß√µes de maior complexidade, como, por exemplo: 
-	instru√ß√µes narrativas simples tais como "furosemida 40mg dois comprimidos pela manh√£ e um no almo√ßo" para assegurar a compatibilidade com os sistemas existentes; 
-	a quantidade do medicamento geralmente √© representada por um n√∫mero e uma unidade de dose correspondente, no entanto, pode haver uma descri√ß√£o em texto livre para garantir a compatibilidade com os sistemas existentes e a cobertura de todos os cen√°rios cl√≠nicos; atrav√©s de
-	detalhes estruturados para a dose, via e dura√ß√£o para representar uma especifica√ß√£o totalmente comput√°vel.

Este arqu√©tipo foi tamb√©m projetado para que uma √∫nica estrutura de prescri√ß√£o de medicamento possa representar:

-	Prescri√ß√µes sequencias complexas de medicamento com a mesma concentra√ß√£o de prepara√ß√£o representados em uma √∫nica estrutura de prescri√ß√£o; e
-	m√∫ltiplas prescri√ß√µes de medicamentos que podem ser encadeadas em circunst√¢ncias em que diferentes medicamentos ou prepara√ß√µes precisem ser administrados sequencialmente.

Este arqu√©tipo √© tamb√©m adequado para prescri√ß√£o de solu√ß√µes parenterais, em cen√°rios de atendimento onde √© normal prescrever estes itens. Em outras cen√°rios, uma prescri√ß√£o separada de solu√ß√µes parenterais poder√° ser mais apropriada.

SLOTs contendo arqu√©tipos do tipo CLUSTER foram utilizados ‚Äã‚Äãpara representar parte do conte√∫do por tr√™s raz√µes:
-	Para garantir que um arqu√©tipo b√°sico possa ser utilizado em todos os casos de uso descritos acima, oferecendo flexibilidade onde for necess√°rio, por exemplo, o SLOT de "Detalhes da prepara√ß√£o", permite que detalhes adicionais estruturados da prepara√ß√£o possam ser adicionados. Existe um arqu√©tipo sugerido para medicamentos. √â poss√≠vel que outros arqu√©tipos do tipo CLUSTER sejam necess√°rios no futuro, para outros fins, como pedidos complexos de nutri√ß√£o parenteral;
-	apoiar a reutiliza√ß√£o do arqu√©tipo em situa√ß√µes em que o conte√∫do foi identificado como sendo utilizado tamb√©m em outros contextos cl√≠nicos, em particular o arqu√©tipo ACTION.medication (para deste arqu√©itpo) para grava√ß√£o de distribui√ß√£o real, administra√ß√£o, etc. e
-	remover o conte√∫do de menor utiliza√ß√£o do n√∫cleo do arqu√©tipo. 

V√°rias prescri√ß√µes podem ser representadas como atividades separadas nesta inst√¢ncia de arqu√©tipo, para, por exemplo, representar prescri√ß√µes de diferentes medicamentos, conectadas entre si, como ocorre na terapia de H. pylori, quando se opta por n√£o prescrever como um √∫nico pacote.

Observar que esses casos de usos acima descritos incluem os casos de uso da Prescri√ß√£o de Medicamento e Medicamentos do FHIR. Isto √©, este arqu√©tipo √© uma correspond√™ncia para ambos os recursos do FHIR, desde que utilizado no contexto apropriado.
pt-br.misuse:
N√£o deve ser utilizado para registrar as atividades relacionadas √† realiza√ß√£o da prescri√ß√£o de medica√ß√£o, vacina, produto nutricional ou item terap√™utico, como detalhes sobre a administra√ß√£o ou a dispensa√ß√£o. Use o arqu√©tipo ACTION.medication para este prop√≥sito.

N√£o deve ser utilizado para registrar o pedido de produtos sangu√≠neos, o que envolve um processo cl√≠nico fundamentalmente diferente e √© prov√°vel que exija informa√ß√µes adicionais diferentes. Use o arqu√©tipo INSTRUCTION.transfusion para este prop√≥sito.

N√£o deve ser utilizado para registrar a ordem de inser√ß√£o de implantes ou dispositivos m√©dicos, como marcapassos e desfibriladores. Utilize o procedimento INSTRUCTION.Para este fim.

en.purpose: To record all aspects of an order of a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item for an identified individual.
en.use:
Use to record all aspects of an order of a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item for an identified individual.

It is intended to be used for any type of medication and related order, whether prescribed by a health professional or available for purchase 'over the counter'. The scope of this medication archetype also includes orders for vaccinations, parenteral fluids or other therapeutic goods, such as bandages, nutritional products or other items that are applied or administered to have a therapeutic effect and which have a common pattern for data recording.

This archetype is designed to be used in a number of clinical contexts, including but not limited to:
- a record in a clinical consultation (COMPOSITION.encounter);
- a written prescription by a physician, dentist, nurse practitioner, or other designated health professional for a medication or nutritional product to be dispensed and administered (within a COMPOSITION.prescription);
- an item in a current medication list, prescription or drug chart (within COMPOSITION.medication_list); and
- an item in a summary document such as transfer of care (COMPOSITION.transfer_summary) or a referral (COMPOSITION.request).

In many cases a medication order will be simple ‚Äì typically for a single medication item with uncomplicated instructions for dispensing and administration. However this archetype is also designed to allow for more complex therapeutic orders. For example:

- a reducing dose of prednisolone over a period of weeks;
- titration of insulin, with dosing dependent on test results;
- multiple medications prescribed simultaneously as part of a single drug regimen, such as a triple therapy for peptic ulcer; and
- intravenous administration of medications or nutrition supplements, including parenteral nutrition.

The archetype has therefore been designed to allow for a range of complexity, from:
- simple narrative instructions for orders like 'furosemide 40mg two tablets in the morning and one at lunch' to ensure compatibility with existing systems; and
- the amount of medication is usually represented in terms of a number and corresponding dose unit, however there can alternatively be a narrative statement to ensure compatibility with existing systems and coverage of all clinical scenarios; through to
- structured detail for dose, route and timing to represent a fully computable specification.

It has also been designed so that a single medication order structure can represent:
- complex sequential medication orders using the same preparation strength to be supported within a single order structure; and
- multiple medication orders can be chained in circumstances where different medications or preparations need to be given sequentially.

This archetype is also suitable for ordering parenteral fluids, in care settings where it is normal practice to make these 'prescribable' items. In other settings a separate 'parenteral fluid order' may be appropriate.

SLOTs containing CLUSTER archetypes have been used to represent some of the content for three reasons:
- To ensure a core archetype that can be used for all the above use cases, yet allow flexibility where it is required, for example the ‚ÄòPreparation details‚Äô SLOT where additional structured detail can be added. A candidate archetype has been suggested for Medications. It is possible that other CLUSTER archetypes may be required in future for other purposes such as complex parenteral nutrition orders;
- to support archetype re-use in situations where the content has been identified as being also used in other clinical contexts, in particular the paired ACTION.medication archetype for recording actual dispensing, administration etc; and
- to remove less commonly used content from the core archetype framework.

Multiple orders can be represented as separate activities within this single archetype instance to carry tightly bound orders of different medications, for example, H. pylori therapy when this is not prescribed as a single pack.

It should be noted that these uses subsume both the FHIR Medication Order and Medication Statement use cases. i.e this archetype is a match for both FHIR resources, used in the appropriate context.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record the activities related to carrying out the order for medication, vaccine, nutritional product or therapeutic item, such as details about actual administration or dispensing. Use the ACTION.medication for this purpose.

Not to be used to record the ordering of blood products, which involves a fundamentally different clinical process and is likely to require different supporting information Use the INSTRUCTION.transfusion for this purpose.

Not to be used to record the order for insertion of implants or medical devices such as pacemakers and defibrillators. Use the INSTRUCTION.procedure for this purpose.

ca.purpose: Enregistrar tots els aspectes d'una ordre de medicaci√≥, vacuna, producte nutricional o un altre element terap√®utic per a un individu identificat.
ca.use:
Utilitzar per a registrar tots els aspectes d'una ordre de medicaci√≥, vacuna, producte nutricional o un altre element terap√®utic per a un individu identificat.

Est√† destinat a ser emprat per a qualsevol classe de medicaci√≥ i ordre relacionada, estigui prescrita per un professional sanitari o disponible per la compra "sense recepta". L'√†mbit d'aplicaci√≥ d'aquest arquetip de medicaci√≥ tamb√© inclou ordres de vacunaci√≥, fluids parenterals o altres productes terap√®utics, com ara embenats, productes nutricionals o altres productes que s'apliquen o s'administren per tindre un efecte terap√®utic i que tenen un patr√≥ com√∫ per al registre de dades.

Aquest arquetip est√† dissenyat per ser emprat en diversos contextos cl√≠nics, incloent-hi per√≤ no limitat a:
- un registre en una consulta cl√≠nica (COMPOSICI√ì.trobada);
- una recepta escrita per un metge, dentista, infermer facultatiu o un altre professional de la salut designat a distribuir o administrar una medicaci√≥ o producte nutricional (dins d'una COMPOSICI√ì.prescripci√≥);
- un element en una llista actual de medicaci√≥, recepta o gr√†fic de mediaci√≥ (dins de COMPOSICI√ì.llista_medicaci√≥); i
- un element en un document de resum com ara un trasllat d'atenci√≥ (COMPOSICI√ì.resum_trasllat) o una derivaci√≥ (COMPOSICI√ì.sol¬∑licitud).

En molts casos, una ordre de medicaci√≥ ser√† simple ‚Äï generalment per a un √∫nic element de medicaci√≥ amb instruccions senzilles per a la dispensaci√≥ i administraci√≥. No obstant aix√≤, aquest arquetip tamb√© est√† dissenyat per permetre ordres terap√®utiques m√©s complexes. Per exemple:

- una dosi de reducci√≥ de prednisolona durant un per√≠ode de setmanes;
- titulaci√≥ (valoraci√≥) de la insulina, amb dosificaci√≥ depenent dels resultats de la prova;
- m√∫ltiples medicaments prescrits simult√†niament com a part d'un r√®gim d‚Äôun √∫nic f√†rmac, com una triple ter√†pia per a √∫lcera p√®ptica; i
- Administraci√≥ intravenosa de medicaments o suplements nutricionals, incloent-hi la nutrici√≥ parenteral.

Per tant, l'arquetip ha estat dissenyat per permetre un rang de complexitat, des de:
- instruccions narratives senzilles per a ordres com "furosemida 40mg dos comprimits al mat√≠ i una al dinar" per garantir la compatibilitat amb sistemes existents; i
- la quantitat de medicaci√≥ es representa normalment en termes d'una xifra i la corresponent unitat de dosi, per√≤ alternativament pot haver-hi una declaraci√≥ narrativa per assegurar la compatibilitat amb sistemes existents i la cobertura de tots els escenaris cl√≠nics; a trav√©s de
- detall estructurat per dosi, ruta i temps d'administraci√≥ per representar una especificaci√≥ totalment mesurable.

Tamb√© s'ha dissenyat de manera que una √∫nica estructura d'ordre de medicaci√≥ pugui representar:
- ordres complexes de medicaci√≥ seq√ºencial utilitzant la mateixa dosificaci√≥ de preparaci√≥ per ser recolzada dins d'una √∫nica estructura d'ordre; i
- es poden encadenar m√∫ltiples ordres de medicaci√≥ en circumst√†ncies on cal donar seq√ºencialment diferents medicaments o preparats.
Aquest arquetip tamb√© √©s adequat per ordenar fluids parenterals, en entorns assistencials on √©s pr√†ctica normal fer aquests elements "prescriptibles". En altres entorns pot ser apropiada una "ordre de fluid parental" separat.

Els SLOTs que contenen arquetips CLUSTER s'han utilitzat per representar una mica del contingut per tres raons:
- Per a garantir un arquetip central que es pot utilitzar per a tots els anteriors casos d'√∫s, per√≤ permet flexibilitat quan sigui necessari, per exemple el SLOT ¬´Detall de preparaci√≥¬ª on es pot afegir detall estructurat addicional. Es va suggerir un arquetip candidat per a Medicacions. √âs possible que altres arquetips CLUSTER en el futur es puguin necessitar per a altres prop√≤sits com ordres complexes de nutrici√≥ parenteral;
- donar suport a la reutilitzaci√≥ d'arquetips en situacions en qu√® el contingut s'ha identificat com a tamb√© fet servit en altres contextos cl√≠nics, en particular l'arquetip aparellat ACCI√ì.medicaci√≥ per registrar la dispensaci√≥ real, administraci√≥, etc; i
- per a eliminar el contingut menys habitualment usat del marc de l'arquetip base.

M√∫ltiples ordres es poden representar com a activitats separades dins d'un √∫nic arquetip per portar ordres estretament lligades de diferents medicaments, per exemple, la ter√†pia H. Pylori quan aix√≤ no es prescriu com un sol paquet.

Cal assenyalar que aquests usos subsumeixen tant els casos d'√∫s de l'Ordre de Medicaci√≥ FHIR com els de la Declaraci√≥ de Medicaci√≥. √âs a dir, aquest arquetip coincideix amb els dos recursos FHIR, utilitzats en el context apropiat.
ca.misuse:
No utilitzar-se per a registrar les activitats relacionades amb la realitzaci√≥ de l'ordre de medicaci√≥, vacuna, producte nutricional o terap√®utic, com ara detalls sobre l'administraci√≥ actual o dispensaci√≥. Utilitzeu la ACCI√ì.medicaci√≥ per a aquest prop√≤sit.

No s'ha d'utilitzar per registrar l'ordre de productes sanguinis, el qual implica un proc√©s cl√≠nic fonamentalment diferent i √©s probable que requereixi informaci√≥ de suport diferent. Utilitzeu INSTRUCCI√ì.transfusi√≥ per a aquest prop√≤sit.

No s'ha d'utilitzar per registrar l'ordre d'inserci√≥ d'implants o dispositius m√®dics com marcapassos i desfibril¬∑ladors. Utilitzeu INSTRUCCI√ì.procediment per a aquest prop√≤sit.

at0070.1.description: Name of the medication, vaccine or other therapeutic/prescribable item being ordered.
at0070.1.comment: Depending on the prescribing context this field could be used for either generic- or product-based prescribing. This data field can be used to record tightly bound orders of different medications when they are prescribed as a single pack. It is strongly recommended that the 'Medication item' be coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible. The extent of coding may vary from the simple name of the medication item through to structured details about the actual medication pack to be used. Free text entry should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available.

at0132.1.description: Permission for substitution with a bioequivalent item.
at0132.1.comment: In many jurisdictions, substitution of an ordered item as a generic form or with a different brand name, which has been determined as bioequivalent, is allowed at the point of dispense or supply. In other cases substitution is assumed and the clinician has to explicitly request non-substitution.

at0012.1.description: The date and optional time to commence use of the ordered item.

at0013.1.description: The date and optional time when it is planned to cease use of the ordered item.

at0000.description: An order for a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item for an identified individual.

at0004.description: Unique identifier for the medication order.
at0004.comment: This data element allows for multiple occurrences to be defined more explicitly at run-time, if required.

at0008.description: Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
at0008.comment: For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.

at0009.description: Complete narrative description about how the ordered item is to be used.
at0009.comment: This narrative should normally subsume data captured in 'Dose amount', 'Dose timing' and any additional instructions for use. Where the medication dose directions are fully carried by the structured, computable dose directions, this element should carry the narrative equivalent, generally auto-generated. If it is not possible to represent the intended 'Dose direction' fully in computable form, partial representation is not recommended, and the directions should be only recorded in narrative form using this data element.

at0011.description: A condition which, when met, requires the commencement of administration or use.
at0011.comment: For example: 'Start if symptoms recur'. This is intended for a general pre-condition which should trigger the whole medication course to be started, and not for 'as required' administrations of an ongoing order.

at0012.description: The date and optional time to commence use of the ordered item.

at0013.description: The date and optional time when it is planned to cease use of the ordered item.

at0016.description: A condition which, when met, requires the cessation of administration or use.

at0018.description: The clinical reason for use of the ordered item.
at0018.comment: For example: 'Angina'. Coding of the clinical indication with a terminology is preferred, where possible. This data element allows multiple occurrences. It is not intended to carry an indication for administrative authorisation purposes.

at0044.description: An additional instruction on how to use or store the ordered item.
at0044.comment: For example: precautions as 'take with food', 'Avoid grapefruit', 'Dissolve in water', 'store in a cool, dry place'. This data element allows multiple occurrences and should be coded with a reference terminology, where possible.

at0047.description: A parsable, computable text representation of the directions.
at0047.comment: Generally this is only used when passing information between legacy systems. For example: '10mg bd; 20mg n' as used by the NHS Dose syntax (in development).

at0050.description: The time period during which the individual/patient has already been using the ordered item as a part of the intended whole order but prior to the issuance of this order.
at0050.comment: For example: To record that the patient had been taking antibiotics 3 days prior to hospital admission, in the context of a 7 day course.

at0051.description: Details about the maximum, cumulative dose allowed over a defined period for the ordered item.
at0051.comment: For example: 'up to 1gram per day'. This cluster allows multiple occurrences to enable representation of multiple maximum doses that apply to different time periods. Lifetime maximum dose should not be carried here as it refers to multiple orders over time.

at0053.description: The period of time during which the maximum dose is calculated.

at0060.description: The number of administrations of the ordered item that have been completed, as part of the intended whole order but prior to the issuance of this order.
at0060.comment: For example: To record that the patient has taken the two first antibiotic tablets of a three day course, prior to discharge from the hospital to a nursing home.

at0062.description: Details about medication safety for the ordered item.

at0064.description: Confirmation by the prescriber that the normal dose or other safety limit has been overridden due to exceptional circumstances.

at0065.description: Details about the amount of the ordered item to be dispensed.
at0065.comment: This SLOT allows for local variation in the different jurisdictions regarding medication dispensing amount to be managed.

at0069.description: Details of authorisation of the ordered item, including supporting local self-administration, issue and endorsement policies.
at0069.comment: For example: details of repeat/refill supply. This SLOT allows for local variation in the different jurisdictions regarding medication authorisation and re-authorisation to be managed.

at0070.description: Name of the medication, vaccine or other therapeutic/prescribable item being ordered.
at0070.comment: Depending on the prescribing context this field could be used for either generic- or product-based prescribing. This data field can be used to record tightly bound orders of different medications when they are prescribed as a single pack. It is strongly recommended that the 'Medication item' be coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible. The extent of coding may vary from the simple name of the medication item through to structured details about the actual medication pack to be used. Free text entry should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available.

at0091.description: The route by which the ordered item is to be administered into the subject's body.
at0091.comment:
For example: 'oral', 'intravenous', or 'topical'.
Coding of the route with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Multiple potential routes may be specified.

at0092.description: Name of the site of administration of the ordered item.
at0092.comment:
For example: 'left upper arm', 'intravenous catheter right hand'.
 Coding of the body site with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

at0093.description: Structured description of the site of administration of the ordered item.

at0094.description: The technique or device by which the ordered item is to be administered.
at0094.comment: For example: ' via Z-track injection'; 'via nebuliser'. Coding of the method with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

at0095.description: Details of the medical device used to assist administration of the ordered item.

at0105.description: An additional instruction directed primarily at the individual/patient or carers.
at0105.comment: For example: 'To reduce your blood pressure', 'To thin your blood'. This data element allows multiple occurrences and should be coded with a reference terminology, where possible. If required it is possible to use a LINK attribute to associate this element with, for example, the 'original diagnosis' in a separate Problem list composition but the indication should be explicitly recorded here, as the link target may change over time.

at0106.description: An additional instruction directed primarily at the person dispensing the ordered item.
at0106.comment: Example: Detailed instructions for phased dispensing of opiates.

at0107.description: An additional instruction which gives advice on recommended or required monitoring of the ordered item.
at0107.comment: For example: 'Please check renal function in 2 weeks'. This data element allows multiple occurrences.

at0112.description: Summary information about use of the ordered item, such as current status or key dates, generally used in non-prescription contexts.
at0112.comment: Course summary may be required when transmitting medication information between systems or representing a FHIR Medication statement. For example: as part of a referral, emergency patient summary or discharge communication.

at0113.description: Details about the whole medication order.

at0129.description: Directions about the dispensing of the ordered item.

at0130.description: The maximum, cumulative amount of medication which should be administered within the allowed period.

at0132.description: Permission for substitution with a bioequivalent item.
at0132.comment: In many jurisdictions, substitution of an ordered item as a generic form or with a different brand name, which has been determined as bioequivalent, is allowed at the point of dispense or supply. In other cases substitution is assumed and the clinician has to explicitly request non-substitution.

at0139.description: An indicator of the urgency with which the ordered item should be dispensed.
at0139.comment: For example 'Urgent'. This is left to be templated or specialised according to local valuesets. Some jurisdictions allow instructions to dispense to be marked as 'urgent' so that the dispensary handles them quickly.

at0143.description: Structured details about the overall medication including strength, form and constituent substances.
at0143.comment: Use this SLOT where the detailed description of the ordered item needs to be explicitly stated. For example: the form, strength, any diluents or mixture of ingredients.

at0148.description: The overall therapeutic intent of the ordered item.
at0148.comment: For example: 'pain relief'; 'palliative care'; 'low-dose prophylaxis'; 'rehydration'; 'nutritional infusion'.

at0150.description: Details about the total daily amount of the ordered item expected to be administered.
at0150.comment: The total daily dose records the expected effective dose, and thus support titration of an initial low dose towards the effective dose over a period of time. This is not itself the target dose or goal but the actual effective daily dose against that goal. In some circumstances the Total daily dose will be calcuable from computable directions, in others it may need to be manually entered.

at0151.description: The amount of ordered item which will be taken each day if administered as intended.

at0154.description: The reason why an ordered item should not be substituted at dispense.

at0155.description: The date from which the ordered item is permitted to be dispensed for the first time.
at0155.comment: May be used to control the time of dispensing of medications with potential for abuse. For example: benzodiazepines or analgesics.

at0161.description: The date after which the ordered item is no longer valid to be legally dispensed.
at0161.comment: In some jurisdictions, orders to dispense may have an expiry date after which the prescription may not be dispensed.

at0162.description: The reason for a clinical safety or maximum dose override.
at0162.comment: For example: 'Not responsive at maximum recommended dose. Critical situation.', 'Peniciilin is only valid treatment, likelihood of true penicillin allergy is low'.

at0165.description: Description of the reason for recording a total daily effective dose.
at0165.comment:
For example: 'Hypertension control', 'Target dose 20mg daily'. The description could be used to identify a name, phrase or paragraph about the purpose for recording total daily effective dose, commonly to allow to titration towards a specific target dose.
The goal or target dose might be recorded here or more commonly as part of a linked EVALUATION 'Goal' archetype.

at0166.description: Additional structured details about the ordered item not captured in other fields.

at0167.description: Additional narrative about the medication order not captured in other fields.

at0168.description: Substitution of the medication with a bioequivalent medication is allowed.

at0169.description: Substitution of the medication with a bioequivalent medication is not allowed.

at0170.description: Further details related to dispense directions.
at0170.comment: This SLOT allows for local variation in the different jurisdictions regarding medication dispensing.

at0171.description: A known or recognised safety issue which applies to this subject and the ordered item, such as an allergy, drug duplication warning or contraindication. This element is normally only recorded when this safety advice is overridden.

at0173.description: A narrative description of a specific part of overall directions.
at0173.comment: In some settings, it is common to split overall narrative directions into more specific segments of narrative. For example in hospital settings, it can be common to split the overall directions into 'Dose amount' and 'Dose timing', both as narrative text. These terms can be applied at template or run-time.

at0174.description: A description of the justification used to calculate a dose amount or administration rate where this is dependent on some other factor.

at0177.description: Details of structured dose and timing directions.
at0177.comment: This SLOT has been designed to be used with the CLUSTER.therapeutic_direction archetype to enable recording of a complex set of dosage and timing directions. While it's possible to use other CLUSTER archetypes within this SLOT, it's strongly advised to do so only when predictable queryability is not a priority.

at0178.description: Overriding of a known or recognised safety issue which applies to this subject and the ordered item, such as an allergy, drug duplication warning or contraindication.

at0179.description: Advice to future prescribers/dispensers about the ongoing, long term order.
at0179.comment: For example: 'don't allow brand substitution' or advice regarding using a specific brand to avoid fillers that cause reactions.

at0179.1.description: Advice to future prescribers/dispensers about the ongoing, long term order.
at0179.1.comment: For example: 'don't allow brand substitution' or advice regarding using a specific brand to avoid fillers that cause reactions.

at0091.1.description: The route by which the ordered item is to be administered into the subject's body.
at0091.1.comment:
For example: 'oral', 'intravenous', or 'topical'.
Coding of the route with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Multiple potential routes may be specified.

at0092.1.description: Name of the site of administration of the ordered item.
at0092.1.comment:
For example: 'left upper arm', 'intravenous catheter right hand'.
 Coding of the body site with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

at0139.1.description: An indicator of the urgency with which the ordered item should be dispensed.
at0139.1.comment: For example 'Urgent'. This is left to be templated or specialised according to local valuesets. Some jurisdictions allow instructions to dispense to be marked as 'urgent' so that the dispensary handles them quickly.

at0173.1.description: A narrative description of a specific part of overall directions.
at0173.1.comment: In some settings, it is common to split overall narrative directions into more specific segments of narrative. For example in hospital settings, it can be common to split the overall directions into 'Dose amount' and 'Dose timing', both as narrative text. These terms can be applied at template or run-time.

at0174.1.description: A description of the justification used to calculate a dose amount or administration rate where this is dependent on some other factor.

at0154.1.description: The reason why an ordered item should not be substituted at dispense.

at0177.1.description: Details of structured dose and timing directions.
at0177.1.comment: This SLOT has been designed to be used with the CLUSTER.therapeutic_direction archetype to enable recording of a complex set of dosage and timing directions. While it's possible to use other CLUSTER archetypes within this SLOT, it's strongly advised to do so only when predictable queryability is not a priority.

at0155.1.description: The date from which the ordered item is permitted to be dispensed for the first time.
at0155.1.comment: May be used to control the time of dispensing of medications with potential for abuse. For example: benzodiazepines or analgesics.

at0016.1.description: A condition which, when met, requires the cessation of administration or use.

at0018.1.description: The clinical reason for use of the ordered item.
at0018.1.comment: For example: 'Angina'. Coding of the clinical indication with a terminology is preferred, where possible. This data element allows multiple occurrences. It is not intended to carry an indication for administrative authorisation purposes.

at0050.1.description: The time period during which the individual/patient has already been using the ordered item as a part of the intended whole order but prior to the issuance of this order.
at0050.1.comment: For example: To record that the patient had been taking antibiotics 3 days prior to hospital admission, in the context of a 7 day course.

at0094.1.description: The technique or device by which the ordered item is to be administered.
at0094.1.comment: For example: ' via Z-track injection'; 'via nebuliser'. Coding of the method with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

at0011.1.description: A condition which, when met, requires the commencement of administration or use.
at0011.1.comment: For example: 'Start if symptoms recur'. This is intended for a general pre-condition which should trigger the whole medication course to be started, and not for 'as required' administrations of an ongoing order.

at0148.1.description: The overall therapeutic intent of the ordered item.
at0148.1.comment: For example: 'pain relief'; 'palliative care'; 'low-dose prophylaxis'; 'rehydration'; 'nutritional infusion'.

at0107.1.description: An additional instruction which gives advice on recommended or required monitoring of the ordered item.
at0107.1.comment: For example: 'Please check renal function in 2 weeks'. This data element allows multiple occurrences.

at0129.1.description: Directions about the dispensing of the ordered item.

at0105.1.description: An additional instruction directed primarily at the individual/patient or carers.
at0105.1.comment: For example: 'To reduce your blood pressure', 'To thin your blood'. This data element allows multiple occurrences and should be coded with a reference terminology, where possible. If required it is possible to use a LINK attribute to associate this element with, for example, the 'original diagnosis' in a separate Problem list composition but the indication should be explicitly recorded here, as the link target may change over time.

at0106.1.description: An additional instruction directed primarily at the person dispensing the ordered item.
at0106.1.comment: Example: Detailed instructions for phased dispensing of opiates.

at0161.1.description: The date after which the ordered item is no longer valid to be legally dispensed.
at0161.1.comment: In some jurisdictions, orders to dispense may have an expiry date after which the prescription may not be dispensed.

at0143.1.description: Structured details about the overall medication including strength, form and constituent substances.
at0143.1.comment: Use this SLOT where the detailed description of the ordered item needs to be explicitly stated. For example: the form, strength, any diluents or mixture of ingredients.

at0166.1.description: Additional structured details about the ordered item not captured in other fields.

at0047.1.description: A parsable, computable text representation of the directions.
at0047.1.comment: Generally this is only used when passing information between legacy systems. For example: '10mg bd; 20mg n' as used by the NHS Dose syntax (in development).

at0009.1.description: Complete narrative description about how the ordered item is to be used.
at0009.1.comment: This narrative should normally subsume data captured in 'Dose amount', 'Dose timing' and any additional instructions for use. Where the medication dose directions are fully carried by the structured, computable dose directions, this element should carry the narrative equivalent, generally auto-generated. If it is not possible to represent the intended 'Dose direction' fully in computable form, partial representation is not recommended, and the directions should be only recorded in narrative form using this data element.

at0062.1.description: Details about medication safety for the ordered item.

at0060.1.description: The number of administrations of the ordered item that have been completed, as part of the intended whole order but prior to the issuance of this order.
at0060.1.comment: For example: To record that the patient has taken the two first antibiotic tablets of a three day course, prior to discharge from the hospital to a nursing home.

at0044.1.description: An additional instruction on how to use or store the ordered item.
at0044.1.comment: For example: precautions as 'take with food', 'Avoid grapefruit', 'Dissolve in water', 'store in a cool, dry place'. This data element allows multiple occurrences and should be coded with a reference terminology, where possible.

at0000.1.description: An order for a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item for an identified individual.

at0000.description: Ordinering av et legemiddel, en vaksine, parenteral v√¶ske, ern√¶ringsprodukt eller medisinsk forbruksmateriell, for et spesifikt individ.

at0004.comment: Dette dataelementet tillater flere forekomster, som ved behov kan defineres mer spesifikt i applikasjonen.

at0008.description: Ytterligere informasjon som er n√∏dvendig for √• registrere lokalt innhold/kontekst, eller for √• sammenstille med andre referansemodeller/formalismer.
at0008.comment: For eksempel lokale informasjonsbehov eller ytterligere metadata for √• kunne tilpasse til tilsvarende konsepter i FHIR eller CIMI.

at0009.description: En komplett fritekstbeskrivelse av hvordan den ordinerte varen skal brukes.
at0009.comment: Denne fritekstbeskrivelsen b√∏r vanligvis omfatte data i "Dosemengde", "Timing" og eventuelle andre instruksjoner. I tilfeller hvor legemiddelets anvisning er fullt strukturert, b√∏r dette feltet inneholde en fritekstekvivalent som vanligvis autogenereres. Er det ikke mulig √• representere de √∏nskede anvisningene i en fullt strukturert form, anbefales ikke delvis strukturert form. I stedet b√∏r anvisningen kun registreres som fritekst i dette dataelementet.

at0011.description: Et vilk√•r for at den ordinerte varen kan tas i bruk.
at0011.comment: For eksempel "Start dersom symptomer kommer tilbake". Dette er ment som et generelt kriterium som setter i gang hele ordineringen, og ikke for behovsadministrering i en p√•g√•ende ordinering.

at0012.description: Dato og valgfri tid for oppstart av den ordinerte varen.

at0013.description: Dato og valgfri tid n√•r det er planlagt √• seponere den ordinerte varen.

at0016.description: Et vilk√•r for at den ordinerte varen skal seponeres.

at0018.description: Den kliniske begrunnelsen for bruk av den ordinerte varen.
at0018.comment: For eksempel "Angina". Koding av klinisk indikasjon med en terminologi foretrekkes, der det er mulig. Dette dataelementet kan repeteres. Elementet er ikke ment for administrativ autorisering.

at0044.description: Tilleggsinstruksjon for hvordan bruke eller lagre den ordinerte varen.
at0044.comment: For eksempel forholdsregler som "tas med mat", "unng√• grapefrukt", "l√∏ses opp i vann" eller "oppbevares p√• et kj√∏lig t√∏rt sted". Dette dataelementet kan repeteres, og b√∏r dersom mulig kodes med en terminologi, f.eks. FEST.

at0047.comment: Brukes vanligvis ved deling av informasjon mellom eldre systemer.

at0050.description: Tidsperioden individet/pasienten har brukt den ordinerte varen i forkant av denne instruksjonen.
at0050.comment: Eksempel: For √• registrere at pasienten har tatt antibiotika i 3 dager av en 7-dagerskur f√∏r en sykehusinnleggelse.

at0051.description: Detaljer om den maksimale kumulative dosen av den ordinerte varen som er tillatt i en definert tidsperiode.
at0051.comment: For eksempel "maks 1 g per dag". Dette clusteret kan repeteres for √• gj√∏re det mulig √• registrere flere maksimumsdoser som gjelder forskjellige tidsperioder. Maksimumsdose for individets levetid registreres ikke har da det viser til flere ordineringer over tid.

at0060.description: Antall administreringer av den ordinerte varen som er utf√∏rt som del av den planlagte ordineringen, men i forkant av denne instruksjonen.
at0060.comment: For eksempel for √• registrere at pasienten har tatt de to f√∏rste antibiotikatablettene av en 3 dagers kur, i forkant av utskrivelse fra sykehus til sykehjem.

at0062.description: Detaljer knyttet til sikkerhet rundt den ordinerte varen.

at0064.description: Bekreftelse fra forskriveren om at den maksimale dosen eller andre sikkerhetsgrenser er overstyrt p√• grunn av spesielle omstendigheter.

at0065.description: Detaljer om mengden av den ordinerte varen som skal utdeles.
at0065.comment: Dette SLOTet tillater lokal variasjon i regelverk for legemiddelutdeling mellom forskjellige myndighetsomr√•der.

at0069.description: Detaljer om autoriseringen for den ordinerte varen, st√∏tter ogs√• selvadministrering, utlevering og retningslinjer for godkjenning.
at0069.comment: For eksempel detaljer om reiterering. Dette SLOTet tillater lokale variasjoner mellom forskjellige myndighetsomr√•der n√•r det gjelder legemiddelautorisering og re-autorisering.

at0070.description: Navnet p√• legemiddelet, vaksinen eller det medisinske forbruksmateriellet som ordineres.
at0070.comment: Avhengig av kontekst kan dette elementet brukes enten for generisk eller varebasert ordinering. Dataelementet kan brukes til √• registrere tett sammenbundne ordineringer av forskjellige legemidler n√•r de ordineres som en pakke. Det anbefales sterkt at "Legemiddel" kodes med en terminologi som underst√∏tter beslutningsst√∏tte der dette er mulig, f.eks. FEST. Niv√• av koding kan variere fra legemiddelnavn til strukturerte detaljer om den aktuelle legemiddelforpakningen som skal brukes. Fritekst b√∏r bare brukes om ingen passende terminologi er tilgjengelig.

at0091.comment:
For eksempel "oral bruk", "intraven√∏st", "p√• huden" eller "enteralt".
Det b√∏r om mulig benyttes terminologi, f.eks. FEST, for √• angi administreringsvei. Det kan spesifiseres flere mulige administreringsveier.

at0092.description: Navn p√• kroppsstedet der den ordinerte varen skal administreres.
at0092.comment: For eksempel "venstre overarm", "intraven√∏st kateter h√∏yre h√•nd". Det b√∏r om mulig benyttes terminologi, f.eks. SNOMED CT eller EDQM standardtermer, for √• angi kroppssted.

at0093.description: Strukturert beskrivelse av administreringsstedet for den ordinerte varen.

at0094.description: Teknikken eller utstyret som brukes for √• administrere den ordinerte varen.
at0094.comment: For eksempel "via Z-trackinjeksjon", "via forst√∏ver". Koding av administreringsmetoden med en terminologi er anbefalt, der det er mulig.

at0095.description: Detaljer om det medisinske utstyret som brukes til √• administrere den ordinerte varen.

at0105.description: Tilleggsinstruksjon prim√¶rt rettet mot pasient og p√•r√∏rende.
at0105.comment: For eksempel "Blodtrykksreduserende", "Blodfortynnende". Dette dataelementet kan repeteres, og b√∏r dersom mulig kodes med en terminologi, f.eks. FEST. Ved behov kan man bruke en lenke for √• assosiere dette elementet med f.eks. den opprinnelige diagnosen i en Problemliste, men det b√∏r likevel registreres tekst her for √• sikre data for fremtiden, siden m√•let for lenken kan endre seg over tid.

at0106.description: Tilleggsinstruksjon prim√¶rt rettet mot personen som deler ut den ordinerte varen.
at0106.comment: Eksempel: Detaljerte instruksjoner for stegvis utdeling av opiater.

at0107.description: Tilleggsinstruksjon som gir r√•d om anbefalt eller n√∏dvendig overv√•kning ved bruk av den ordinerte varen.
at0107.comment: For eksempel "kontroller nyrefunksjon om 2 uker". Dette dataelementet kan repeteres.

at0112.description: Oppsummerende informasjon om bruk av den ordinerte varen, f.eks. n√•v√¶rende status eller n√∏kkeldatoer, som regel brukt i andre sammenhenger enn resepter.
at0112.comment: Sammendrag av ordineringsinformasjon kan v√¶re p√•krevd n√•r man overf√∏rer legemiddelinformasjon mellom systemer eller representerer et FHIR "Medication statement". Eksempler: Som del av en henvisning, overf√∏ringsnotat, eller epikrise/utskrivingsrapport.

at0129.description: Veiledning for utdeling av den ordinerte varen.

at0130.description: Den maksimale kumulative legemiddelmengden som b√∏r administreres i perioden.

at0132.description: Indikerer om generisk bytte med en bioekvivalent vare er tillatt.
at0132.comment: I mange myndighetsomr√•der er generisk bytte av en ordinert vare mot en bioekvivalent vare fra en annen produsent tillatt. I andre omr√•der er bytte forutsatt, og ordinerende kliniker m√• eksplisitt avsl√• bytte.

at0139.description: En indikator for hastegraden den ordinerte varen b√∏r utdeles under.
at0139.comment: For eksempel "Haster". Dette kan spesifiseres i en templat eller spesalisering etter lokale verdisett. Noen myndighetsomr√•der tillater at resepter merkes med "Haster" for at de skal klargj√∏res fort hos apoteket.

at0143.description: Strukturerte detaljer om det overordnede legemiddelet, blant annet styrke, form og substansene det best√•r av.
at0143.comment: Bruk dette SLOTet til √• spesifisere en detaljert beskrivelse av den ordinerte varen. For eksempel form, styrke, fortynningsmiddel eller blandinger av ingredienser.

at0148.description: Overordnet terapeutisk hensikt med den ordinerte varen.

at0150.description: Detaljer om den totale daglige mengden av den ordinerte varen som skal administreres.
at0150.comment: Den totale daglige effektive dosen er den forventede effektive dosen, og st√∏tter i s√• m√•te titrering av en i utgangspunktet lav dose mot en terapeutisk dose over en tidsperiode. Dette er ikke i seg selv m√•ldosen, men den effektive daglige dosen mot m√•ldosen. I noen sammenhenger kan den totale daglige dosen kalkuleres fra maskinlesbare anvisninger, mens den i andre m√• legges inn manuelt.

at0151.description: Mengden ordinert vare som skal tas per dag dersom det administreres som ordinert.

at0154.description: Begrunnelsen for beslutningen om at generisk bytte av den ordinerte varen ikke tillates.

at0166.description: Ytterligere strukturerte detaljer om den ordinerte varen som ikke omfattes av andre felt.

at0167.description: Ytterligere fritekst om legemiddelordineringen som ikke er fanget i andre felt.

at0168.description: Generisk bytte med bioekvivalent legemiddel er tillatt.

at0169.description: Generisk bytte med bioekvivalent legemiddel er ikke tillatt.

at0170.comment: Dette SLOTet tillater lokal variasjon i regelverk for legemiddelutdeling mellom forskjellige myndighetsomr√•der.

at0173.description: Fritekstbeskrivelse av en spesifikk del av den overordnede anvisningen.

de.purpose:
Zur strukturierten Darstellung einer therapeutischen Anweisung f√ºr ein angefordertes therapeutisches / verordnungsf√§higes Pr√§parat.

Jede Anweisung gilt in der Regel f√ºr eine bestimmte Dauer oder eine bestimmte Anzahl von Verabreichungen.
de.use:
Eine Anweisung beschreibt ein oder mehrere aufeinanderfolgende therapeutische Verabreichungsmuster. Sie fasst eine Gesamtdauer der Anweisung und Details eines sich wiederholenden Musters einer beabsichtigten Verabreichung au√üerhalb eines einzelnen Tages zusammen.

Zum Beispiel: ‚Äû1 Tablette morgens, 1 Tablette abends, f√ºr 3 Wochen, montags, mittwochs und freitags‚Äú. Dieser Cluster kann wiederholt werden, um einen vollst√§ndigen Satz von Anweisungen zur Dosierung f√ºr eine einzelne Medikamentenverordnung darzustellen. Der Cluster kann im Template oder zur Laufzeit der Anwendung umbenannt werden, um eine bestimmte Dosisgabe darzustellen, z. B. "Anfangsdosis", "Bolus".

Im Allgemeinen wird dieser Archetyp im Kontext eines √ºbergeordneten INSTRUCTION-Archetyps verwendet. Er wurde speziell f√ºr die Verwendung im Rahmen einer komplexen Verordnung von Medikamenten, einschlie√ülich intraven√∂ser Medikation, aber auch f√ºr die Verordnung von Fl√ºssigkeiten im Zusammenhang mit Transfusionen oder Dialyse entwickelt.

nb.purpose:
For √• registrere strukturerte detaljer om en enkelt anvisning for en ordinert terapeutisk vare.

Hver anvisning er generelt gyldig i et gitt tidsintervall eller antall administreringer.
nb.use:
En anvisning beskriver en eller flere sekvensielle terapeutiske administreringsm√∏nstre, sammen med en overordnet anvisningsvarighet og detaljer om repetisjonsm√∏nstre for administrering utover en gitt dag.

For eksempel "1 tablett om morgenen og en tablett om kvelden i tre uker, p√• mandager, onsdager og fredager". Clusteret kan repeteres for √• kunne representere et fullstendig sett av anvisninger for en enkelt legemiddelordinering. Clusteret kan gis nytt navn i et templat eller i applikasjonen for √• representere en spesifikk dosering som for eksempel: "Bolus" eller "Startdose".

Arketypen vil generelt bli brukt innenfor en overordnet INSTRUCTION-arketype. Den er spesielt designer for bruk innenfor en kompleks legemiddelordinering inkludert intraven√∏se legemidler, eller for ordinert v√¶ske i sammenheng med transfusjon eller dialyse.

pt-br.purpose:
Para registrar detalhes estruturados de uma √∫nica instru√ß√£o terap√™utica para um item terap√™utico prescrito.

Cada instru√ß√£o geralmente se aplica por uma determinado per√≠odo de tempo, ou por um n√∫mero fixo de administra√ß√µes.
pt-br.use:
*A direction describes one or more sequential therapeutic administration patterns, coupled with an overall direction duration and details of any repetitive pattern of intended administration outside a single day.

For example: '1 tab in the morning, 1 tab at night, for 3 weeks, on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays'. This cluster allows multiple occurrences to enable representation of a complete set of dosage directions for a single medication order. The cluster can be renamed in template or at run-time to represent a specific dosing event such as 'loading dose', 'bolus'.

This archetype will generally be used in the context of a parent INSTRUCTION archetype. It has been specifically designed for use within a complex Medication order including IV medication, or for fluid orders in the context of transfusion or dialysis. (en)

en.purpose:
To record structured details of a single therapeutic direction for an ordered therapeutic/prescribable item.

Each direction generally applies for a given duration, or fixed number of administrations.

nb.purpose: For √• registrere kombinasjonen av en legemiddeldose og administrasjonstidspunkter innenfor en dag, som del av en legemiddelordinering eller legemiddelh√•ndtering, eller for andre ordinerte produkter der det er passende.
nb.use:
Brukes for √• registrere kombinasjonen av en legemiddeldose og administrasjonstidspunkter innenfor en dag, som del av en legemiddelordinering eller legemiddelh√•ndtering, eller for andre ordinerte produkter der det er passende. M√∏nsteret for administrasjonstidspunkter innenfor en dag kan v√¶re s√• enkelt som ett administrasjonstidspunkt, eller flere administrasjonstidspunkter med forskjellige niv√•er av kompleksitet.

Timingdetaljer som ikke er innenfor √©n dag, f.eks. ukentlig eller m√•nedlige timinger, h√•ndteres av CLUSTER-arketypen "Timing - repetering" som benyttes i CLUSTER-arketypen "Terapeutisk anvisning".

Innenfor en INSTRUCTION og i den igjen innenfor CLUSTER-arketypen "Terapeutisk anvisning" (CLUSTER.therapeutic_direction) for √• registrere dose og timing av et ordinert produkt, som f.eks. et legemiddel.

Innenfor en ACTION-arketype kan denne arketypen brukes for √• registrere dosen og timing for den faktiske administreringen av det ordinerte produktet.

Spesifikke tidspunkter for administrering og start/stopp-tidspunkter spesifiseres i CLUSTER-arketypen "Timing - daglig".

pt-br.purpose: Para gravar a combina√ß√£o de uma quantidade de medicamento e o tempo de administra√ß√£o di√°rio, como parte de uma solicita√ß√£o ou gest√£o de medicamentos ou para outros itens terap√™uticos/prescritos apropriados.
pt-br.use:
Usado para gravar a combina√ß√£o de uma quantidade de medicamento e o tempo de administra√ß√£o di√°rio, como parte de uma solicita√ß√£o ou gest√£o de medicamentos ou para outros itens terap√™uticos/prescritos apropriados.
O padr√£o de tempo di√°rio pode ser simples como uma administra√ß√£o √∫nica ou m√∫ltiplas administra√ß√µes com n√≠veis variados de complexidade.

Os detalhes de tempo que n√£o est√£o dentro de um mesmo dia p.e. semanalmente ou mensalmente s√£o inclu√≠dos dentro do arqu√©tipo CLUSTER "Timing repetition" carregado dentro do arqu√©tipo CLUSTER "Therapeutic direction".

No contexto de uma INSTRU√á√ÉO terap√™utica este arqu√©tipo pode ser inserido dentro do SLOT "Dosage administration" no CLUSTER "Therapeutic direction" para gravar a dose e detalhes de tempo do padr√£o de uma administra√ß√£o √∫nica de um item terap√™utico.

No contexto de um arqu√©tipo tipo ACTION insira este arqu√©tipo diretamente no SLOT "Amount" para gravar a dose e tempo da administra√ß√£o de um item terap√™utico.

Tempos espec√≠ficos de in√≠cio e parada de administra√ß√£o devem ser especificados dentro do arqu√©tipo CLUSTER "Timing - daily".

en.purpose: To record the combination of a medication amount and the administration timing within a single day, as part of a medication order or medication management or for other appropriate therapeutic/prescribable items.
en.use:
Use to record the combination of a medication amount and the administration timing for a single day, as part of a medication order or medication management or for other appropriate therapeutic/prescribable items. 
The timing pattern for a single day can be as simple as a single administration time, or multiple administration times with varying levels of complexity.

Timing details which are not within a single day e.g weekly or monthly timings are carried in the CLUSTER 'Timing repetition' archetype carried within the CLUSTER 'Therapeutic direction' archetype.

In the context of a therapeutic INSTRUCTION this archetype may be inserted into the 'Dosage administration' SLOT in the 'Therapeutic direction' CLUSTER to record the dose and timing details of the pattern of single intended administrations of a therapeutic item. 

In the context of an ACTION archetype insert this archetype directly into the 'Amount' SLOT to record the dose and timing of the actual administration of a therapeutic item.

Specific administration start/stop times should be specified within a contained CLUSTER 'Timing - daily' archetype.

at0178.1.comment: For example: "Apply ointment to affected area until it glistens". This element is intended to allow implementers to use the structures for increasing/tapering dosages without necessarily specifying the doses in a structured way.

at0145.1.description: The unit which is associated with the Dose amount.
at0145.1.comment: For example: 'tablet','mg'. Coding of the dose unit with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

at0000.description: The combination of a medication amount and administration timing for a single day, in the context of a medication order or medication management.
at0000.comment: For example: '2 tablets at 6pm' or '20mg three times per day'. Please note: this cluster allows multiple occurrences to enable representation of a complete set of dose patterns for a single dose direction.

at0037.description: Structured details about the timing pattern for a single day.

at0102.description: The period of time over which a single dose of the medication or vaccine should be administered.

at0134.description: The rate at which the medication, such as an infusion, is to be administered.
at0134.comment: For example: '200 ml/h'. Use the text data type to record non- or semi-quantifiable instructions.

at0135.description: The formula used to calculate the dose amount or administration rate where this is dependent on some other factor, such as body weight or surface area.
at0135.comment: For example: '10mg/kg/day'. The result of this formula would normally be held in Dose amount/unit or Administration rate/duration. Where clinical measurements such as body weight is used in the dose calculation, a LINK attribute should used to specify which particular measurement has been used.

at0144.description: The value of the amount of medication administered at one time, as a real number, or range of real numbers, and associated with the Dose unit.

at0176.description: An alternate representation of the value of the amount of medication administered at one time, as a real number, or range of real numbers, and associated with the Dose unit.

de.purpose: Zur Repr√§sentation strukturierter Informationen √ºber den geplanten Zeitablauf einer therapeutischen oder diagnostischen Aktivit√§t innerhalb von 24 Stunden.
de.use:
Zur Repr√§sentation strukturierter Informationen √ºber √ºber den geplanten Zeitablauf einer therapeutischen oder diagnostischen Aktivit√§t innerhalb eines Zeitraums von 24 Stunden.

Dieser Archetyp ist so konzipiert, dass er innerhalb des SLOTs "T√§gliche Verabreichungszeiten" des Archetyps CLUSTER.dosage verwendet werden kann. Er kann aber auch in anderen CLUSTER- und ENTRY-Klassen-Archetypen verwendet werden, wenn dies klinisch sinnvoll ist.
de.misuse: Nicht zur Repr√§sentation von Informationen zum Zeitablauf, der innerhalb l√§ngeren Zeitraums als 24-Stunden liegt, verwenden. Verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.timing_nondaily.

nb.purpose: For √• registrere strukturert informasjon om planlagt timing av en terapeutisk eller diagnostisk aktivitet innenfor ett d√∏gn.
nb.use:
Strukturert informasjon om planlagt timing av en terapeutisk eller diagnostisk aktivitet innenfor ett d√∏gn.

Arketypen er laget for √• brukes i SLOTet "Administreringstidspunkt" i arketypen CLUSTER.dosage (Dosering), men kan ogs√• brukes i andre CLUSTER- og ENTRY-arketyper der det er klinisk passende.
nb.misuse: Skal ikke brukes til √• registrere detaljer om timing over lengre tidsperioder enn et d√∏gn. Bruk arketypen CLUSTER.timing_repetition for dette form√•let.

sl.purpose: *To provide structured information on time schedules within a single day that is suitable for computation and display for human interpretation.(en)

en.purpose: To record structured information about the intended timing of a therapeutic or diagnostic activity within any 24 hour period.
en.use:
Use to record structured information about the intended timing of a therapeutic or diagnostic activity within any 24 hour period.

This archetype is designed to be used within the 'Timing' SLOT within the CLUSTER.dosage archetype, but can also be used in other CLUSTER and ENTRY class archetypes where clinically appropriate.
en.misuse: Not to be used for recording timing details over periods longer than a single 24 hour period. Use the CLUSTER.timing_repetition archetype for this purpose.

at0025.1.description: The condition which triggers an 'As required' activity.

at0000.description: Structured information about the intended timing of a therapeutic or diagnostic activity within any 24 hour period.

at0003.description: The frequency as number of times per time period that the activity is to take place.
at0003.comment: For example: "4 times per day" or "3 to 4 times per hour".

at0004.description: A specific time or interval of time when the activity should occur.

at0014.description: The time interval or minimum and maximum range of an interval between each scheduled activity.
at0014.comment: For example: "Every 4 hours" or "Every 4 to 6 hours".

at0023.description: Is exact timing of the activity critical to effectiveness, or patient safety or wellbeing?
at0023.comment: For example when administering antiparkinson medications.

at0024.description: Record as True if the activity should only occur when the "'As required' criterion" is met.
at0024.comment: Termed 'PRN' ("pro re nata", latin: "as the situation arises") or 'PN' ("per necessare", latin: "when required") in some cultures.

at0025.description: The condition which triggers an 'As required' activity.

at0026.description: The name of the event that triggers the activity to take place.
at0026.comment: For example: "Before each meal", "at bedtime", "in the morning". It is understood that these event names may not equate to the same exact times in different cultures. Coding with a terminology, for example HL7 FHIR Named events, is recommended where appropriate.

at0027.description: Text description of the daily timing. This element is intended to allow implementers to use the structures for different timings without necessarily specifying the timings in a structured way.

at0035.description: A cycle of activity where an on-off pattern is required.
at0035.comment: For example: "Apply an ice pack on for 20 minutes, off for an hour, repeat".

at0036.description: The period of time for which the activity should take place.

at0037.description: The period of time for which the activity should NOT take place.

at0038.description: The number of repetitions of the on/off cycle.

at0039.description: A specific, named time event that the activity should occur in relation to.

at0040.description: The period of time before or after the named event when the activity should take place. Negative durations can be used to signify that the activity should take place before the event.
at0040.comment: For example: '30 minutes after meal = meal + 30 minutes', '2 hours before bedtime = bedtime -2 hours'.

at0026.comment: For eksempel: F√∏r hvert m√•ltid, ved leggetid, om morgenen. Det er underforst√•tt at disse termene ikke n√∏dvendigvis tilsvarer de samme tidspunktene i forskjellige kulturer. Koding med en terminologi, for eksempel HL7 Named events, anbefales der det er passende.

at0027.description: Tekstbeskrivelse av timingen innenfor et d√∏gn. Dette elementet er ment for √• tillate implementeringer √• bruke de overordnede strukturene rundt timing, for eksempel √∏kning eller nedtrapping, uten n√∏dvendigvis √• oppgi timingen strukturert.

at0035.description: En aktivitetssyklus som krever et p√•/av-m√∏nster.
at0035.comment: For eksempel "bruk en ispose p√• i 20 minutter, av i en time, gjenta".

at0037.description: Tidsperioden da aktiviteten IKKE skal utf√∏res.

at0039.description: En spesifikk, navngitt hendelse aktiviteten skal utf√∏res i sammenheng med.

at0040.description: Tidsintervallet f√∏r eller etter hendelsen n√•r aktiviteten skal utf√∏res. Negative intervaller kan benyttes for √• spesifisere at aktiviteten skal utf√∏res f√∏r den navngitte hendelsen.
at0040.comment: For eksempel "30 minutter etter m√•ltid = m√•ltid + 30 minutter" eller "2 timer f√∏r sengetid = sengetid -2 timer".

at0025.1.description: Vilk√•ret som utl√∏ser en aktivitet som er "Ved behov".

at0003.1.description: Frekvensen for aktiviteten som skal finne sted, angitt som antall ganger per tidsperiode.
at0003.1.comment: For eksempel "4 ganger per dag" eller "3-4 ganger per time".

at0014.1.description: Tidsintervall eller minimums- og maksimumsintervall mellom hver planlagte aktivitet.

at0024.1.description: Registrer som Sann dersom aktiviteten kun skal utf√∏res n√•r "Vilk√•r for "Ved behov"" inntreffer.
at0024.1.comment: Kalles "PRN" ("pro re nata", latin "n√•r situasjonen oppst√•r") eller "PN" ("per necessare", latin: "n√•r p√•krevet") i noen kulturer.

at0035.1.comment: For eksempel "bruk en ispose p√• i 20 minutter, av i en time, gjenta".

at0004.1.description: Et spesifikt tidspunkt eller tidsintervall n√•r aktiviteten skal finne sted.

at0027.1.description: Tekstbeskrivelse av timingen innenfor et d√∏gn. Dette elementet er ment for √• tillate implementeringer √• bruke de overordnede strukturene rundt timing, for eksempel √∏kning eller nedtrapping, uten n√∏dvendigvis √• oppgi timingen strukturert.

at0026.1.comment: For eksempel: F√∏r hvert m√•ltid, ved leggetid, om morgenen. Det er underforst√•tt at disse termene ikke n√∏dvendigvis tilsvarer de samme tidspunktene i forskjellige kulturer. Koding med en terminologi, for eksempel HL7 Named events, anbefales der det er passende.
